title: Generic Sensor networks Application Interfaces
description: International Standard that depicts generic sensor network applications’ operational requirements, description of sensor network capabilities, and mandatory and optional interfaces between the applications.

title: Water Reuse
description: This standard covers technical, economic, environmental and societal aspects of water reuse. Considering water reuse topic, this standard covers all value-chain considering operations involved in collection, conveyance, processing, storage, distribution, consumption, drainage of wastewater, treated effluents and cascaded recycled cycles. Moreover, the standard also covers as important topic the impact of water quality in water use and recycling.

title: Irrigation and drainage equipment and systems
description: This standard is focusing on physical systems for maximizing the irrigation and agriculture production. Based on that, the specific standards developed covers the design and implementation of volumetric valves (ISO 7714:2018), Filter for micro irrigation (ISO9912-4:2018), testing of agricultural irrigation equipment (ISO/TR 15155:2018), etc.

title: Water Quality
description: This standard comprise the understanding of water quality terminology combined with a broad strategy for measuring, sampling and characterizing water quality (including physical, chemical, biochemical, biological and microbiological) procedures and measurements (including radioactivity measurements).

title: Life Cycle Assessment
description: Standardization in the field of life cycle assessment and related environmental management tools for products and organizations. It includes life cycle-based resource efficiency and eco-efficiency assessment and encompasses consideration of a life cycle perspective in the assessment of impacts from the extraction of raw materials to the final disposal of waste. These standards directly contribute to circular economy, resource efficient and process/services symbioses about natural resources.

title: Service activities relating to drinking water supply, wastewater and stormwater systems
description: Standardization of the management concepts for service activities relating to drinking water supply, wastewater and stormwater systems. These standards are related with the relation with the customer and the subsequent services for operation and maintenance activities, service provision during crisis, water loss reduction and management, stormwater management, governance for water utilities, continuous service monitoring for water quality and asset management services related to water supply and wastewater systems.

title: Sludge recovery, recycling, treatment and disposal
description: Methods for characterizing, categorizing, preparing, treating, recycling and managing sludge and products from urban wastewater collection systems, night soil, storm water handling, water supply treatment plants, wastewater treatment plants for urban and similar industrial waters. It includes all sludge that may have similar environmental and/or health impacts.

title: Hydrometry
description: Methods, procedures, instruments, and equipment relating to techniques for hydrometric determination of water level, velocity, discharge and sediment transport in open channels, precipitation and evapotranspiration, availability and movement of ground water.

title: Measurement of fluid flow in closed conduits
description: This set of standards include terminology, rules and methods for measuring fluid flows in closed conduits. These standards also include conditions and guidelines to construct instruments and equipment required.

title: Standard for Measures of the Software Aspects of Dependability
description: This standard covers the development of software resilient software and services. The methods and guidelines target critical systems for which reliability, maintainability, availability, security, and, in some operational contexts, safety, usability, and privacy are essential characteristics.
sdo: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers

title: Standard for Measures of the Software Aspects of Dependability
description: Set of standards focused on communication between End Devices considering requirements of Advanced Metering Infrastructure (AMI) and Smart Grids. This covers data exchange with Extensible Markup Languages (EML) and Exchange Data Languages (EDL).
sdo: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers

title: WaterML
description: Standard information model for the representation of water observations data, with the intent of allowing the exchange of such data sets across information systems. Through the use of existing OGC standards
sdo: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers

title: WaterML2-Timeseries (Part 1)
description: This standard is mainly focused on harmonising time series structures with  other standards such as GML, CSML, netCDF and SWE common profiles. The time series and corresponding representation of the measures are following the ISO19156 (Observation and Measurement).

title: WaterML2-Ratings, Gaugings and Sections (Part 2)
description: This data exchange model is focused on hydrometry. In this regard, this model is focused on hydrology measuring river flow, hydrological conversions and their related observations.

title: WaterML2-HY_FEATURES (Part 3)
description: Reference model defining real-world water-objects and the way they relate to each other according to hydro-science domain defined by semantics and network topology.

title: GroundwaterGML2 (Part4)
description: This data exchange model that represent logical and encoding standard for representing groundwater data. This standard has been elaborated for exchange information about the management of groundwater resources, to make interoperable groundwater modelling systems and lately,enhance the interoperability diverse water informational systems.

id: Digital Single Market for Water Services Action Plan
title: Digital Single Market for Water Services Action Plan
description: This reference document depicts the EU strategy towards “smart water society” by promoting ICT technology in water domain. In that sense, this document depicts main strategy in different pillars: (i) Interoperability & Standardization (I&S); (ii) Data Sharing (DS), (iii) Smart Water (SW); (iv) Cyber-Security (CS); (v) Water & Digital (AW); (vi) Policy (POL); and (vii) Business Model (BM).

title: SmartM2M
description: This corresponds to the specifications and design of a high level architecture to enable machine to machine communication.

title: SAREF4WATER
description: SAREF corresponds to a semantic model (ontology) for representing contextual information of water systems and their interrelation with the physical domain. SAREF will enable the cross-domain interoperability while offer a data model with context based metadata.

title: NGSI-LD
description: This reference model corresponds to an open API for the integration of smart city data at cross-domain whilst compliant with GDPR. NGSI-LD open API manages the information in form of graph-databases and serialize it in JSON-LD. Moreover, the open API specification is also compliant with FIWARE high level architecture.

title: Service Description and Requirements
description: This reference model corresponds to an open API for the integration of smart city data at cross-domain whilst compliant with GDPR. NGSI-LD open API manages the information in form of graph-databases and serialize it in JSON-LD. Moreover, the open API specification is also compliant with FIWARE high level architecture.

title: Functional reference architecture for communications in smart metering systems
description: A European standard comprising a software and hardware open architecture for utility meters that supports secure bidirectional communication upstream and downstream through standardized interfaces and data exchange formats and allows advanced information and management and control systems for consumers and service suppliers.

title: INSPIRE Directive
description: This Directive corresponds to a data model to share geospatial information and statistics in Europe. Moreover, this directive also offers a architecture for data sets sharing between EU countries.

title: Regulation on geo-blocking and other forms of discrimination based on customers' nationality, place of residence or place of establishment within the internal market and amending.
description: This regulation is mainly focused on give customers better access to goods and services in the Single Market by preventing direct and indirect discrimination by trades artificially segmenting the market based on customers' residence.

title: The Water Framework Directive and the Floods Directive: Actions towards the 'good status' of EU water and to reduce flood risks
description: Implementation report to effective water management in preparation for extreme events which, due to climate change, are becoming more frequent and cause tremendous damages.

title: Water Drinking Directive
description: Main aim of this regulation is to protect human health from adverse effects of any contamination of water intended for human consumption by ensuring that it is wholesome and clean.

title: EU Water Framework Directive.
description: Regulation to protect water based on natural geographical formations such as rivers and lakes. This regulation ensures relevant stakeholders to to use clean water and then strengthen the economy around it.

title: Flood Risk Directive
description: The main motivation of this directive is to assess and manage flood risk that are being more and more continuous due to the climate change impacts and events.

title: Environmental quality standards applicable to surface water
description: This standard is focused on concerning the presence in surface water of certain substances or groups of substances identified as priority pollutants because of the significant risk they pose to or via the aquatic environment.
